text: Michael Alaifatu N. Mika (born 24 July 1968) is a Samoan former rugby union player. He played as Prop. ==Career== Mika was born in Lower Hutt, and first played for Samoa during the quarter-finals against South Africa during the 1995 Rugby World Cup. Although he was part of the 1999 Rugby World Cup roster, playing three matches in the tournament, with his last international cap being during the match against Wales, at the Millennium Stadium, Cardiff. ==Post- career== Currently, he works as lawyer at Preston Russell Law, based in Invercargill.http://www.roarsports.co/mike-mika/He is a SANZAAR Judicial Technical Advisor and performs the same role on the World Rugby Judicial Panel. He is also a Judicial Officer of the Oceania Rugby Judicial Panel.http://www.prlaw.co.nz/our-people/partners/mike-mika/ ==References== ==External links== * *Mike A. N.
